column4: so how come I get this http://twitpic.com/44iamp when I attempt to install 10.10? I do have a lable called "/" but that's not a mount point.  So how do I create a "/" mount point?
it's not the label you wanna change
I know but where do I get to add the mount point?
yes there should be, but don't know why there aren't!
look at the gparted window.  there is clearly a linux partition
is the mounted question for me?
don't use gparted at the same time? just use the installer, will you only be installing ubuntu?
I only went to gparted when nothing appeared in the Installed
I only went to gparted when nothing appeared in the Installer
will you only be installing ubuntu?
no, I have windows on other partition
have you tried selecting "install side by side"?
what options did you get?

I double click on the "Install Ubuntu 10.10" icon and i get a welcome screen to select English, which I do, then I click on "Forward" then I get "Preparing to install Ubuntu" all green checkmarks, i click on "Forwrard" and I get "Allocate Drive Space"
no partitions are to be found in the allocate space. Look at http://twitpic.com/44iamp
change the option elected in the drop down menu, tell me what you can see?
look at http://twitpic.com/44juvp
okso what about the drop down as mentioned in your first image dump
/dev/sda is only thing in the drop down in the "Allocate drive space"
close gparted
device is not mounted, gparted is closed.
did you do an md5sum on the ISO?
still nothing!
